channel.title: Server + client won't work together (317 client)

item.title: Server + client won't work together (317 client)
item.dc:creator: @Umah Umah
item.description:
@Umah wrote:

There’s alot of possibilities on why it’s not running. One thing is that you didn’t portforward, no-ip Duc isn’t running if you portforwarded, and not using bit/utorrent, maybe it’s on the wrong server port, and alot more. Maybe you just left out another "setserver "

Read full topic
item.source: Server + client won't work together (317 client)

item.title: Server + client won't work together (317 client)
item.dc:creator: @gamerbug gamerbug
item.description:
@gamerbug wrote:

I have a good server, and a client that is supposed to work together, but I go to change the ip for the server… and all that junk, and it doesn’t work anymore :(… I was hoping I could make it into my OWN server, and my OWN client and changing like a ton of stuff, but it won’t work… I can’t find where I went wrong…

I’ve done all the obvious places for your server ip… I’ll show you mine, well what I’ve found obvious… client-side.

public final void init() { try { anInt957 = 0; anInt958 = 0; method52(true); aBoolean959 = true; signlink.storeid = 32; signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost()); setserver("crystalscape.sytes.net", "43594"); method2(503, false, 765); } is one,

public static final void main(String args[]) { try { anInt957 = 0; anInt958 = 0; method52(false);//highmem aBoolean959 = true;//members signlink.storeid = 32; signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost()); client client1 = new client(); client1.method1(503, false, 765); setserver("crystalscape.sytes.net", "43594"); return; } is another

anInt1171 = 1; aString1173 = ""; aString1174 = ""; server = "crystalscape.sytes.net"; aBoolean1176 = false; anInt1178 = -1; aClass19_1179 = new Class19(169); anInt1184 = 128; is the last one.

all I want to know is if there is like a directory thingy there… that well, has it redirect over to the files in the server folder and stuff…

Read full topic
